div1.ab: Minister of the Navy and the Colonies
Office of the Political Regime and Commerce.
on the subject of the declaration of independence of the Republic of Liberia.
div1.p:
Citizen Minister and dear colleague,
The colony of Monrovia founded in June 1822, on the west coast of Africa, by an American society, to serve as assistance for the emancipated slaves, in the United States, declared itself independent of this society in August 1849, and constituated itself as a Sovereign State, under the name of Republic of Liberia.

The following September 2nd, the government of Liberia officially notified Mr. Chaigneau french lieutenant commander of war, Bougainville in station at this point, the declaration of independence of the colony. It addressed at the same time to this officer a counterpart of the constitution voted the preceding July 29th, and a map of the territory of the Republic.
div1.ab: to Citizen Minister of Foreign Affairs.
div1.p: In transmitting February 21st 1848, these documents to the Minister of the Navy and the Colonies, the commander of the french naval forces on the west coast of Africa, informed that the commodore Hotham, in the name of the British government, and the american officer placed at the head of the station of the United States, recognized the Republic of Liberia, and that they gave the order to recognize its flag.
Mr. Montagniès of the Rogue abstained from making the same manifestation, until he received the instructions from the Gouvernement.

My opinion is that there is place to prescribe to his successor, Mr Captain of vessel Baudin, to proceed immediately to the recognition of the new Republic.
